question: The law of large numbers is fundamentally related to the meaning of probability.
If a Bayesian analysis and a frequentist analysis give the same numerical answer, you cannot say that one is better or worse than the other.
It is legitimate to model degrees of belief with probability theory.
Any model of degrees of belief that is not probability theory is wrong.
It is possible to experimentally verify that the value of a probability is correct.
Probabilities based on subjective intraspection have no role in science.
